channel.title: Exceptions - arrgghh! (No not a n00b question)
channel.description:
OK, so i've modified so that it implements my Client interface. On loading the client using this: [code]Class clazz = Class.forName(...);[/code]
[s]My JVM spits out one nasty exception: [code] Exception in thread "main" java.lang.IncompatibleClassChangeError: Implementing class at java.lang.ClassLoader.defineClass1(Native Method) at java.lang.ClassLoader.defineClass(ClassLoader.java:620) at java.security.SecureClassLoader.defineClass(SecureClassLoader.java:124) at java.net.URLClassLoader.defineClass(URLClassLoader.java:260) at java.net.URLClassLoader.access$100(URLClassLoader.java:56) at java.net.URLClassLoader$1.run(URLClassLoader.java:195) at java.security.AccessController.doPrivileged(Native Method) at java.net.URLClassLoader.findClass(URLClassLoader.java:188) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:306) at sun.misc.Launcher$AppClassLoader.loadClass(Launcher.java:268) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:251) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClassInternal(ClassLoader.java:319) at rf.a(Unknown Source) at vd.<clinit>(Unknown Source) at na.<clinit>(Unknown Source) at java.lang.Class.forName0(Native Method) at java.lang.Class.forName(Class.java:164) at joey.asm.Bot.<init>(Bot.java:27) at joey.asm.updater.Updater.<init>(Updater.java:76) at joey.asm.updater.Updater.main(Updater.java:152) [/code]
[s]I've absolutly no idea about how to fix it. I think its actually in the runescape code but anyway. Any idea on how to fix it anyone?[/s]
Now it spits out this: [code]java.lang.InstantiationException: client at java.lang.Class.newInstance0(Class.java:335) at java.lang.Class.newInstance(Class.java:303) at joey.asm.Bot.<init>(Bot.java:30) at joey.asm.updater.Updater.<init>(Updater.java:76) at joey.asm.updater.Updater.main(Updater.java:152) [/code]

item.description:
@joey0101 wrote:

BAsh(CntLgn):

Then how the hell would java create an instance of it? Even if you don’t include a constructor in source code it adds an empty one in anyway.

I fixed every thing completely and managed to find a few fields as well. You can have the updater source if you want…

item.title: Exceptions - arrgghh! (No not a n00b question)
item.dc:creator: @joey0101 joey0101
item.description:
@joey0101 wrote:

OK, this is strange. Even if I leave the client unmodified it still produces that same exception, now i’m really confused :S[br][br][size=1]Posted on: March 25, 2008, 04:57:39 AM[/size][hr][quote=“yakman, post:4, topic:192810”]the bcel library has a bytecode verifier, you could run your client class through that to see if there is anything wrong in that sense
i havent checked, but asm might have a verifier too[/quote]
Yes it does, i’ll run my code through that now.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: March 25, 2008, 05:15:49 AM[/size][hr]OK, I fixed that (thanks yakman for pointing out the verifier thing). But now when I try to create the class I get this exception:

java.lang.InstantiationException: client at java.lang.Class.newInstance0(Class.java:335) at java.lang.Class.newInstance(Class.java:303) at joey.asm.Bot.<init>(Bot.java:30) at joey.asm.updater.Updater.<init>(Updater.java:76) at joey.asm.updater.Updater.main(Updater.java:152)

Read full topic

item.title: Exceptions - arrgghh! (No not a n00b question)
item.dc:creator: @joey0101 joey0101
item.description:
@joey0101 wrote:

To modify the bytecode i’m using ObjectWeb ASM, and I don’t think that I’ve changed any methods in the Client class only added - public int getLoginIndex(). And I think that it is something to do with my interface - joey/asm/updater/interfaces/Client - and the method in there different to the one found in the client. Let my try loading it without putting any interfaces in the client.

Read full topic
item.source: Exceptions - arrgghh! (No not a n00b question)

item.title: Exceptions - arrgghh! (No not a n00b question)
item.dc:creator: @semaphore semaphore
item.description:
@semaphore wrote:

Do you use the built in class-tooling to intercept/modify bytecode before it gets loaded or do you use a 3rd party suite to do so? Either way this is likely thrown when the class definition has changed, say a method signature is different, but classes that call that method have not been changed. For example:

Class A:
public static void doSomething(String str);

changed externally to

Class A:
public static void doSomething(String str, int i);

and Class B calls doSomething(“here”). This would give you that error when the jvm tries loading the classes.

Read full topic
item.source: Exceptions - arrgghh! (No not a n00b question)

item.title: Exceptions - arrgghh! (No not a n00b question)
item.dc:creator: @joey0101 joey0101
item.description:
@joey0101 wrote:

OK, so i’ve modified so that it implements my Client interface. On loading the client using this: Class clazz = Class.forName(...);

[s]My JVM spits out one nasty exception:

Exception in thread "main" java.lang.IncompatibleClassChangeError: Implementing class at java.lang.ClassLoader.defineClass1(Native Method) at java.lang.ClassLoader.defineClass(ClassLoader.java:620) at java.security.SecureClassLoader.defineClass(SecureClassLoader.java:124) at java.net.URLClassLoader.defineClass(URLClassLoader.java:260) at java.net.URLClassLoader.access$100(URLClassLoader.java:56) at java.net.URLClassLoader$1.run(URLClassLoader.java:195) at java.security.AccessController.doPrivileged(Native Method) at java.net.URLClassLoader.findClass(URLClassLoader.java:188) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:306) at sun.misc.Launcher$AppClassLoader.loadClass(Launcher.java:268) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:251) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClassInternal(ClassLoader.java:319) at rf.a(Unknown Source) at vd.<clinit>(Unknown Source) at na.<clinit>(Unknown Source) at java.lang.Class.forName0(Native Method) at java.lang.Class.forName(Class.java:164) at joey.asm.Bot.<init>(Bot.java:27) at joey.asm.updater.Updater.<init>(Updater.java:76) at joey.asm.updater.Updater.main(Updater.java:152)

I’ve absolutly no idea about how to fix it. I think its actually in the runescape code but anyway. Any idea on how to fix it anyone?

Now it spits out this:

java.lang.InstantiationException: client at java.lang.Class.newInstance0(Class.java:335) at java.lang.Class.newInstance(Class.java:303) at joey.asm.Bot.<init>(Bot.java:30) at joey.asm.updater.Updater.<init>(Updater.java:76) at joey.asm.updater.Updater.main(Updater.java:152)
